Package geometry

Class Position

java.lang.Object
geometry.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The Position class's role to store the location of a Piece's reference inside Board.layout.
Author:
Patrick Barry, Philip Murray
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • x

      public int x
      the x coordinate of the Position. Corresponds to Piece's Rank.

    • y

      public int y
      the y coordinate of the Position. Corresponds to Piece's File.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position​(int x, int y)
      Constructor for the Position class.
      Parameters:
      x - Coordinate x for a piece.
      y - Coordinate y for a piece.

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Position p)
      Compares if Position p have the same x and y coordinates as this Position.
      Parameters:
      p - Position of Piece.
      Returns:
      true If positions are equal. false - If positions are not equal.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(int x, int y)
      Compares if a Piece's Position constructed from the provided x and y coordinates equals this Position.
      Parameters:
      x - Coordinate x of Piece.
      y - Coordinate y of Piece.
      Returns:
      true If positions are equal. false - If positions not equal.

    • addVector

      public Position addVector​(int x, int y)
      Returns a position are translated by a given x and y from this Position. Useful for Passant-Pawn finding by adding +- (0, 1)
      Parameters:
      x - x component of vector
      y - y component of vector
      Returns:
      new Position obtained from adding vector from given x and y components to this Position.
